title: MoveSIN
text:
This is the website for the Ecological Society of Australia’s Movement Ecology Special Interest Network Special Interest Network (MoveSIN). You can check out the listing on the ESA website here.

Movement ecology is the field of understanding and predicting animal movement. It typically involves the analysis of data from animal-mounted sensors such as Global Positioning System (GPS) and other telemetry devices, as well as from non-spatial sources such as accelerometers and magnetometers. Movement ecology typically falls into broad categories that include space use and home ranges, resource and step selection analyses, movement predictions, and behavioural classification.
Animal movement data provides a rich source of information to understand animal ecology, and has provided countless behavioural and ecological insights, but processing animal movement data can be challenging. There are a number of considerations when analysing animal movement data, and the growing number of conceptual and statistical approaches can make it hard to get started.
Around Australia, researchers are applying exciting movement ecology tools and analysing animal movement datasets, which we aim to bring together through meetings, seminars and ‘bring-your-problem’ workshops. We hope this will help to create a collaborative network that will benefit both experienced researchers and those just embarking into movement ecology.

We aim to

Hold a meeting/seminar/workshop every 2-3 months
Host a symposium at the ESA conference
Have a social event at the ESA conference
Use the SIN to connect researchers working on similar problems



Get in touch
General email: ausmovementecology@gmail.com


Committee Members

Scott Forrest, scottwforrest@gmail.com
Mitchell Cowan, mitchell.cowan@uwa.edu.au
Inka Veltheim, inka.veltheim@deeca.vic.gov.au
Patrick Finnerty, patrick.finnerty@sydney.edu.au
James Pay, james.pay@utas.edu.au



Join the Movement Ecology Special Interest Network
Sign-up here! https://forms.gle/XqZXXLH73XBN26QS7


Follow us on social media
Bluesky account: https://bsky.app/profile/ausmovementecology.bsky.social
We started the Movement Ecology Special Interest Network after the ESA 2024 conference in Melbourne and are keen to get new members. Please join us if you have an interest in movement ecology!

title: Welcome!
text:
Hello! This is the first post on the Movement Ecology Special Interest Network website. We are still getting things up and running, but we will soon be hosting seminars, which are open to all. To join the mailing list, fill in the Google form here: https://forms.gle/XqZXXLH73XBN26QS7.
